topics.body:
!https://crayfisher.files.wordpress.com/2015/07/daily-show-spit-take.gif!
Apparently a new *MASSLESS* particle has been discovered called the Weyl fermion.  Why is this important?  Obviously it won't happen for a long time but it would make electronics 1000 times faster.  If we had the capability to use it for electronics today your desktop computer would be as powerful as Watson the supercomputer.

THE FUTURE IS NIEGH
topics.author: 50c204917f123b31440000a5

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55b1302f63687224c0000171#post_55b1302f63687224c0000171

Since it's a quantum particle not sure there's going to be a factible way of using it.

Theoretically, if something has no mass in it's regular state you can't predict how it will react or how it will interact with the rest of the matter.

topics.body:
"@QuasarNova":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55b1313b6368721241000cda#post_55b1313b6368721241000cda
The thing is though that it's such a odd ball that it goes in a straight line.  Normally with those types of particles they curve and that, but with this particle it don't give a fuck and it do what it wants cause it's a strong independent subatomic particle that don't need no gravitational force to tell it what to do.
